title.quote: Title: Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Networks

extractions.description: This paper introduces a novel Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN) for signed graph representation learning. The proposed model leverages low-pass and high-pass graph convolution filters derived from spectral graph theory to separately process positive and negative links within signed graphs. Additionally, a self-gating mechanism is implemented to adjust the impact of low- and high-frequency information within the message passing framework. The model aims to address the balance and differentiation between positive and negative links, and achieves state-of-the-art performance on real-world signed graph datasets.

type.justification: The paper includes experimental results to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed model over various competitive baselines, thus it is empirical.
type.quote: Experimental results demonstrate that SLGNN outperforms various competitive baselines and achieves state-of-the-art performance.

name.justification: The paper is focused on developing a novel Graph Neural Network for signed graph representation learning.
name.quote: we propose a novel signed graph representation learning framework, called Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN)...

name.justification: The paper heavily relies on spectral graph theory for designing its graph convolution filters.
name.quote: Motivated by these analyses, we introduce a Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN) for signed graph representation learning, which can effectively capture the structural information of signed graphs.

name.justification: The paper bridges the connection between graph signal processing and signed graph modeling.
name.quote: In this paper, we propose a solution based on spectral graph theory (Chung and Graham 1997) and graph signal processing (Dong et al. 2016).

name.justification: The model proposed in the paper is named Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN).
name.quote: In this paper, we propose a novel Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN) for signed graph representation learning, which can effectively capture the structural information of signed graphs.

is_contributed.justification: SLGNN is the novel model introduced by the authors in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we propose a novel Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN) for signed graph representation learning.

is_executed.justification: Experiments were performed using SLGNN to validate its performance.
is_executed.quote: Experimental results demonstrate that SLGNN outperforms various competitive baselines and achieves state-of-the-art performance.

is_compared.justification: SLGNN's performance is compared with multiple baseline models in the experimental section.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results demonstrate that SLGNN outperforms various competitive baselines and achieves state-of-the-art performance.

referenced_paper_title.justification: SLGNN is the primary contribution of this paper and does not reference another paper for its origination.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In this paper, we propose a novel Signed Laplacian Graph Neural Network (SLGNN) for signed graph representation learning, which can effectively capture the structural information of signed graphs.

name.justification: BitcoinAlpha is one of the datasets used in the experiments.
name.quote: BitcoinAlpha and BitcoinOTC are who-trusts-whom networks of people who trade on Bitcoin platforms and tag the others trust or distrust.

referenced_paper_title.value: Leskovec, J.; Huttenlocher, D.; and Kleinberg, J. 2010. Predicting positive and negative links in online social networks. In Proceedings of the 19th international conference on World wide web, 641–650.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset's origin is cited in the paper.
